alert.note: Alert for Halifax (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 8:32AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Halifax County through 900 AM EDT... At 831 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Littleton, or 10 miles southwest of Roanoke Rapids, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and up to an inch of rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Roanoke Rapids, Weldon, South Weldon, Airlie, Rosemary, Roanoke Rapids Lake and Medoc Mountain State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
